comment.author: 9667502@N04
comment._content: A marvel in its day for its sheer size in such a young colony.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Does anyone know who the statue is and where he has moved to?  Nearby Prince Albert and Queen Victoria have been moved around Queen's Square like a couple of chess pieces.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: This looks like the statue of William Bede Dalley (1831-1888), the prominent 19th century New South Wales political figure, barrister, philanthropist, arts patron, etc. Re the statue, check out this 1897 Australian Town and Country Journal article - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article71292694. You can read Dalley's ADB entry at adb.anu.edu.au/biography/dalley-william-bede-3356. I've been banished to Queensland for years and only rarely manage to obtain a pass to visit my former home colony (otherwise I'd make a trip to Hyde Park to check), but I'm sure that this statue is still in Hyde Park somewhere. I'd be mortified if it isn't. Was it moved when the underground railway was being built? PS - This Tyrrell Collection is superb! Thanks Powerhouse people for putting the pics up on Flickr. I've only recently discovered them.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Thanks for all that information. It seems that William Bede Dalley was quite a character. The statue still stands at the NE corner of Hyde Park - Google Maps Street View - g.co/maps/zy63v Phew! I hope you know about the Persistent URL link above and the Zoom function - just amazing!

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Thanks for pointing out the Purl etc. Good to see WBD is still around!
